flawed_nl_solution:
First, subtract the number of days Jenna can't read from the number of days in September: 30 days - 4 days = <<30-4=26>>26 days.
Then subtract the one day when Jenna will read 100 pages: 26 days - 1 day = <<26-1=25>>25 days.
Now subtract the 100 pages Jenna will read on her flight from her overall goal: 600 pages - 100 pages = <<600-100=5000>>5000 pages.
Finally, divide that number of pages by the number of days Jenna will read the standard amount: 5000 pages / 25 days = <<5000/25=200>>200 pages per day.
#### 200

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 500, not 5000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
